definition: synonym
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Being a woman is synonymous with being a second-class citizen, in her opinion.
sentences.chinese: 在她看來，做女人是做二等公民的同義詞。

sentences.english: We should pay attention to synonym discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 我們應注意對同義詞的辨析。

sentences.english: Khiva's name became synonymous with cruelty and barbarity in contemporary Britain when, in 1842, two army officers, Colonel Charles Stoddart and Captain Arthur Conolly, were beheaded here in public.
sentences.chinese: 在當代英國，希瓦這個名字是殘暴和野蠻的同義詞。

sentences.english: The semantic synonym expansion mechanism is limited to expand simple keyword queries.
sentences.chinese: 語義同義詞擴展機制僅限於擴展簡單的關鍵字查詢。

sentences.english: By default, assign a much smaller integer to all the synonyms.
sentences.chinese: 默認情況下，爲所有同義詞指定一個較小的整數。

sentences.english: In their minds, effort is synonymous with discomfort.
sentences.chinese: 在他們心目中，努力是不適的同義詞。

sentences.english: Eveningwear is practically synonymous with sexy.
sentences.chinese: 晚裝似乎就是性感的同義詞。

sentences.english: Network marketing is synonymously referred to as Multi-Level-Marketing or MLM.
sentences.chinese: 網絡營銷是同義詞稱爲多層次營銷還是傳銷。

sentences.english: Synonyms can have slightly different connotations.
sentences.chinese: 同義詞之間的內涵意義會略微不同。

sentences.english: The words "partition" and "group" are used synonymously here.
sentences.chinese: 在此“劃分”和“分組”用作同義詞。

sentences.english: This restricts the size of each synonym to this maximum size.
sentences.chinese: 這將約束每個同義詞的最大大小。

sentences.english: The term is often used synonymously with hydrocarbon indicator.
sentences.chinese: 該術語通常用做碳氫指示的同義詞。
一部常用同義詞辨析詞典。

sentences.english: Some common parameters have synonyms, and a few have antonyms.
sentences.chinese: 一些常見的參數有同義詞，而少數具有反義詞。

sentences.english: There're many correspondent synonyms between connatural Korean words and those in ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮語固有詞與漢語有同義詞羣對應關係。

sentences.english: But the ancient Chinese synonyms research is weak in dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 但是，目前古代漢語同義詞的研究還比較零散和薄弱。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
printed style (as opposed to cursive)/typeface
radical of a compound word (in European language)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to force someone to do something
alas/all is lost
voice (grammar)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to be chivalrous
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
phonetic change
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
